Please Contact Us
​
For all Marina inquiries, including slip rentals, please call:
239-495-3222
For all inquiries about Backwater Jacks restaurant, including private events, please call us at:
239-992-3010
​
For all inquiries about Sweetwater Lifestyles Boat Club or any charter boats, including fishing & sunset charters, please call:
239-405-7155
You can reach key members of our team
at the contacts below:
​
Meet the Team
​
Marina
Captain Tibe Larson
Vice President of Marina Operations
239-495-3222
tibel@bonitabaymarina.net

239-495-3222
caras@bonitabaymarina.net

Manager & Chef
239-992-3010
cory@bonitabaymarina.net

About the Marina
/$
/$
/$
/$
$
$
/$
$
$
BONITA BAY MARINA
Essential Information
Phone: (239) 495-3222
Fax: (239) 495-0801
GPS Location: N26° 20.315 W 081° 49.677
Staff:
Marina Manager/VP of Operations:
Tibe Larson
Dockmaster:
Stephen Kildahl
Ships Store Manager: Caraline Shapton
Hours of Operation: 8:00 a.m. – 5:00 p.m.
The Marina is open 7 days a week (closed Thanksgiving, Christmas Day, and New Year's Day).
/$
$
/$
$
Selling A Boat?
Try Our New Classified Ads
/$
$
Instructions
/$
$
Download Ad Form
/$
$
/$
$
Marina-Recommended Vendors
/$
$
Click Here

Updated Channel Chatter
/$

/$
/$
$
/$
$
/$
$
/$
$
/$
$
$
/$
$
Take to the Water With Sweetwater Lifestyles!
/$
$
/$
$
Widely considered the best charter service in Southwest Florida, Sweetwater has been a Bonita Bay tradition since 1992. Offering sunset cruises, dolphin tours, fishing charters and much more, Sweetwater Lifestyles is the ideal way to hit the water!
/$
$
Visit Now
/$
/$
$
$
Visiting the Marina
​
If you are interested in visiting the Marina, please call us at 239-495-3222 so we can clear you through the Gate House the day of your visit.
Having Your Boat Launched
​
Boats are launched between 8:30 am and 4:00 pm daily.  We utilize an online software product called BoatCloud to schedule launches.  When your boat arrives for storage, you will receive an email link to join BoatCloud.  To save time at the dock, you can request fuel and ice on the Boat Cloud, as well as live shrimp (during season from October through April).  Alternatively, you can call the Ships Store at
239-495-3222
one hour in advance to have your
boat launched (subject to available launch times).
​
Using the Marina After Hours
​
Launching:
Request a launch time through BoatCloud or call the Ships Store at
239-495-3222
before 3:30 p.m. Your boat will be tied to the floating dock for your use.
Returning:
Tie your boat to the floating dock; Marina staff will pull your boat in the morning.
Holidays:
For Christmas, Thanksgiving, and New Year's Day, please alert the Ships Store the day ahead if you would like to have your boat available.
​
Purchases & Payments
​
Boaters are encouraged to use their Marina account for Marina Purchases. Guests may pay via ACH, with Cash, Visa, or MasterCard.
​
Storage
​
The length of the boat is determined by measuring the distance from the back of the engine or platform to the front of the anchor or pulpit. Maximum draft at the Marina is 36” (per our permitting agreement).
Storage is billed on the 25th day of the month for the upcoming month of storage.
Click the link below for storage rates or call
Tibe Larson
at
239-495-3222
for more information and availability.
​
CLICK HERE TO STORAGE RATES
​
Work Racks
​
There are several work racks for boaters’ use, and can be used for washing, waxing, and repairs to the vessels. Racks are available on a first-come first- served basis. As a courtesy to other boaters, during the busy season please limit the time for washing of boats to ½ hour. All vessels must be out of the water to be washed.
​
Mobile Mechanics
​
For repairs required on vessels, there are several independent mobile mechanics available for assistance. If a vessel is under warranty, dealers are permitted to perform warranty work here as well. All vendors must have a Certificate of Insurance on file with the Marina. More information is available at the Ships Store.
​
Services Available
Through the Marina
​
Please click the link below for services and rates available through the marina or call
239-495-3222
for more information or to request services.
​
CLICK HERE TO VIEW SERVICES
​
Safety Recommendations
& Helpful Hints
​
The Marina monitors
channel 72 VHF
during normal operating hours.
Towing insurance is recommended for all boat owners. Bonita Bay Marina has partnered with Tow Boat U.S. For more information please call Tow Boat U.S. directly at 239-945-1664.
The US Coast Guard monitors VHF Channel 16 in case of an emergency.
A waterway chart showing the route from the Bonita Bay Marina to the Gulf of Mexico is available at the Ships Store. The marked route is north from the Marina to New Pass.
When there is a Hurricane Watch issued the marina may choose to bring some or all of the boats moored outside into dry dock for the storm. Boats who are affected will be billed a “hurricane haul out” fee. If you are concerned about a storm, call the marina at 239-495-3222, or e-mail
tibel@bonitabaymarina.net
The Marina is available for assistance with all your boating needs.
Should you have any questions or need boating advice, please feel free to visit the Ships Store in person or by phone at 239-495-3222. Our friendly staff will be happy to assist you in every possible way.
​
​
​
